comments.body:
It also needs deep copy generation comments.
```
// +k8s:deepcopy-gen:interfaces=k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/runtime.Object
```
I think it can be beneficial to briefly explain why `TypeMeta` is needed.
Done, but I'm not too familiar Kubernetes persisting mechanism, so PTAL to see if my comment is correct.

I wouldn't put it as a comment in the code example, but as a separate paragraph. Maybe something like:

>  Please note that we embed `k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/apis/meta/v1/TypeMeta` to include API metadata for versioning and persistence. More info: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#api-conventions

This also needs deep copy generation comments.
```
// +k8s:deepcopy-gen:interfaces=k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/runtime.Object
```

Could we also add another paragraph explaining why this comment is needed? For instance:

> We add `// +k8s:deepcopy-gen:interfaces=k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/runtime.Object` comment to auto-generate `DeepCopy` function. More info: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/tree/master/staging/src/k8s.io/code-generator

I would just link to https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/scheduling-framework/

And point to where the interfaces are defined. The rest is subject to change.

I've linked to that doc page, but I propose restricting this PR to just the `KubeSchedulerConfiguration` part (leaving that TODO in to fill in the interfaces part as I'm inexperienced at writing a new plugin).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1,5 @@# Scheduler Framework Plugins

## Creating a new in-tree plugin

Read [the docs](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/scheduling-framework/)

When a `KubeSchedulerConfiguration` object is parsed (happens in

the versioned type to the internal type, filling in the unspecified fields with

@@ -1,1 +78,82 @@### Validating configuration at runtime

Next, we need to define validators to make sure the user's configuration and
your default values are valid. To do this, add something like this in
`pkg/scheduler/apis/config/validation/validation_pluginargs.go`:

comments.body: I don't think this line is needed and the previous line should be obvious

I don't think it hurts to have a second reminder. `make clean` is pretty destructive and I fear someone might just follow the code parts of this doc without carefully reading the test (I know I'm guilty of doing that sometimes).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +102,106 @@```sh
$ cd $GOPATH/src/k8s.io/kubernetes
$ git add -A && git commit
$ make clean
$ ./hack/update-codegen.sh
